   "source": [
    "import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n",
    "\n",
    "# Labels for each slice of the pie.\n",
    "labels = [\n",
    "    'Looks like pacman',\n",
    "    'Doesn\\'t look like pacman'\n",
    "]\n",
    "\n",
    "# Values representing slice sizes (obtained from government webpage).\n",
    "sizes = [315, 90]\n",
    "\n",
    "# Whether to 'explode' a slice of the pie, and by how much.\n",
    "explode = [0, 0.1]\n",
    "\n",
    "# Colours for each slice\n",
    "colors = ['yellow', 'black']\n",
    "\n",
    "# Make the plot\n",
    "fig, ax = plt.subplots()\n",
    "\n",
    "# Plot the pie chart\n",
    "handles,_,_ = ax.pie(\n",
    "    x=sizes, \n",
    "    explode=explode, \n",
    "    labels=None, \n",
    "    autopct='',\n",
    "    shadow=False, \n",
    "    startangle=45, \n",
    "    colors=colors\n",
    ")\n",
    "\n",
    "# Equal aspect ratio ensures that pie is drawn as a circle.\n",
    "ax.axis('equal')  \n",
    "\n",
    "# Add legend\n",
    "ax.legend(handles, labels, loc='best')\n",
    "\n",
    "# Set title\n",
    "ax.set_title('Pacman');\n",
    "\n",
    "fig.savefig('pacman.jpg')"
   ]
  },
